basics.name: Terry Palomares
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: Motivated and creative student with a passion for Computer Science. Pursuing a BS in Computer Science at the University of Hawai'i at Manoa.

highlights: Created REST APIs with Django Rest Framework, and documentation to allow client developers to obtain paginated and secure, aggregated data.
Secured and authenticated REST APIs, and web applications using server side encryption as well as JSON Web Tokens.
Expedited unit testing by 200% creating Python and bash scripts to easily manage and execute thousands of files.
VB.NET and MSSQL development on sensitive taxpayer data.
Designed data and created documentation to be used for front facing taxpayer tutorial videos.
Development of a system that automated content population that resulted in a 150% speed increase.
Developed a scraper that produced high volume, accurate data with less than 2% error with Selenium and BeautifulSoup.
Designed, modeled, and developed a Django application that aggregated data per authenticated user and allowed sorting, searching and filtering.

work.position: Computer Systems and Networking Support Assistant
highlights: Merged a LAMP stack server for the entire Electrical Engineering department to a newer server, and maintained it.
Branched off the success of our hackathon solution.
Lead developer for the web and scraping application for retrieval of 20,000 statutes.

volunteer.summary: Assisted with general technology related inquiries.
highlights: Refurbishing donated computers, which included troubleshooting, repairing hardware, installing software/operating systems, cleaning inside and out of computers.
Traveled to clientsâ€™ homes to setup, install and troubleshoot computer hardware and software.

awards.title: 2nd Place Overall Solution
awards.summary: Team of 4 took on the Hawaii Revised Statutes challenge to interpret 20,000 statutes, and create a user friendly, scalable solution aimed at improving technology for the State of Hawaii.

awards.title: 1st Place IoT Solution & Best Use of AT&T M2X
awards.summary: Team of 4 that won 2/8 total awards. Gamified plant-monitoring system web application named Demeter. Made with Meteor that tracked data given by a Raspberry Pi through AT&T M2X.

awards.title: Honorable Mention
awards.summary: Third Place in the region of Hawaii for the International Collegiate Programming Contest
